name: Febry Dewiany
review_text: I don't think it was really that affordable like their slogan says, especially the food they are selling at their cafeteria (honestly it's too expensive and not worth it). And you gonna spend minimum 1 hour at the que for rental if you don't book online beforehand. But it's a good place for a first timer like me who wanted to try snowboarding or skiing. And the best part is, they have a huge parking space.

name: Anthony Jay Caronongan
review_text: Good stuff

name: 7FRaGs
review_text: Really enjoyed snowboarding and tobogganing here, especially with the lift and conveyor belt, so riding the toboggan isn't tiring

name: Gavin Q
review_text: Ok, but main lift was closed

name: M T
review_text:
I recently organised a ski trip for a number of families. I have skied quite a lot but most of the group were beginners. I was very happy to have chosen Selwyn!! I was at Thredbo one month ago so easy to compare. Selwyn is so chilled compared to the craziness of Thredbo. There are more runs over there but you really pay for it! The cost of the lift tickets and lessons were so much better and affordable at Selwyn. I particular wanted to mention Stefan and Jimmy who taught my daughter. She learned so much more than at her snow boarding lesson at Thredbo. They they really encouraged her and before the day was out, she was all over the mountain!
I also want to acknowledge those on the lifts. They were so friendly and fun!
Thanks so much our entire group had a really wonderful trip and we will definitely be back!

name: Peter Launders
review_text: Great place to learn to ski as more affordable than the bigger resorts. But are short on staff and often snow as well. Be much better if they could open all the lifts and runs.

name: Aid Rawlins
review_text:
A fun time had by all - mid week visit, the weather was warming up but the slopes had snow cover from natural snow and snow making so a number of the lifts and slopes were running as well as the tobbaggan slope and Wes' wonderfully carpet - 'kids loved it but the Mrs was the tobbagganing champion! All the staff were really happy and helpfull, food and drinks was delicious from the cafe and bistro, toilets and seating area was really clean and tidy.  We had a private lesson booked for 9.30am with Max who was a really good teacher really helped us to get the most out of the day. We stayed in Adaminaby (great food at the 'Goose) which meant we could get to Selwyn early before it got busier. Fantastic driving home in the evening seeing lots of wild brumbies between Selwyn and Ada".
Will defo return

name: Phillip Wicks
review_text:
This was without doubt the worst waste of money but i promised my wife i wouldnt create a fuss but what a rip off. Phone answered by msg tells you save 20% by booking on line absolute BS. Service was so bad they just want to take your money by anymeans as much as your wiling to part with. Food expensive bland pultry serves drinks same. Place is uncomfortable if you just there to watch.
Alround so badly set up it was a nightmare.

name: Fred Anth Cruz
review_text: This snowfield is more child friendly. The equipment hire line was not too long. I visited on a non-school holiday weekend. You can't bring your own Tobaggan - you buy a Toboggan escalator pass online and it comes with a free Toboggan to use.

name: Emma
review_text: The snow was slippery and almost impossible to ski on I came here on my year 6 camp with my class and it sucked because the instructors seemed mad just because we didn't get something the first time and when my friend fell off the lift when getting off an instructor came to help her but he stepped on the back of her skis and screamed at her to get up and dragged her upwards like so horrible I'm never going skiing in Canberra again

name: Francis Jusay
review_text: Small but amazing. Love the "magic carpet" for my daughter. Was only there for 2 hours and will stay longer next time for sure. Not much mountain driving to get there and a bonus sighting of Brumbies!!!!

name: phillip oliver
review_text: I had no wait as I did not ski. I only had a look to see if the daily ski reviews were as misleading as they sounded. I am a local that lives nearby. I first went to Selwyn in the late 70's and loved it. I have been there so often over the years and it has usually been great. I taught my kids to ski there. There is now no snow, mostly mud and whilst it is sad for the workers and the owners and management - it so so much safder for the people being encouraged to go there at the moment and spend their money. If you want a true review make sure you read recent ones. The 5 year old ones (pre fire) are the great ones and SO THEY SHOULD BE. I really can't believe Kevin Blyton would want to treat families and customers the way they are being treated. Give the families a go and if they get there let them play for free until proper snow comes. Surely Blyton group would be better with some good will. People won't come back when being treated as they state in their endless current one star reviews. The buildings look great but mud is no good. We are in a new and likely permanent new climate. Some of us remember when the snow at Sewyn was great and the toilets stunk. I hope it comes back. ps Love the new toilets.

name: Liana (DeFs7)
review_text:
Great little day trip, even towards the end of the season. Kids had a great time tobogganing.
We brought our own toboggans to avoid the rental lines, but you don't even need to line up for them, they're stored at the bottom of the "magic carpet", just grab and go :)
Food and drink is a bit expensive, so try to bring your own.
We will be back next year!
2.5hr drive from Wagga. No snow chains required in 4WD.
Beautiful scenic drive, even saw wild brumbies.
Grab fuel in Tumut as no petrol stations at the resort.

name: Sarah Burns
review_text: The worst thing that can happen is there's no snow. Even though there are snow guns, they don't put them on. And every day less and less snow. Until you have one chair lift and a tiny bit of snow with 100 people sludging around. Very depressing when you've booked accommodation, rentals, lift passes etc. Spent thousands. Save yourself the trouble and expense and head further into the mountains for a guaranteed snow extravaganza. Plus they don't answer the phones, or get back to you via email. And the staff are vague about snow making.

name: Roy Kelly
review_text: Had a good teacher showing us how to snow board , picked it up quick and had a fun day ,

name: Jason Leadbitter
review_text: Second trip to Selwyn this season with the family. The service here is absolute superb! Super family friendly. Special shoutouts to the liftie Zacharia(who plays some seriously good tunas from the boombox), the ski instructor Gilbert and the friendly lad in the cafe Nino. A great little mountain for the little ones to earn and learn their turns before hitting the bigger mountains. Great to see the staff in a cheerful mood with the bistro lad belting out Whitney Houston's "I will always love you" while setting up and the ski patrol joining in.

name: Raunak Koirala
review_text: It's busy and parking can be a problem however, its affordable unlike other resorts and it is not too steep even for beginners.

name: Matthew Hopkins
review_text:
Don't waste your money or time.
Even with half price $60 lift tickets it's not worth the trip there.
It was my 5 year olds first time skiing and the instructors he had for ski school were good but apart from that the place should not have been open with the lack of snow. For the 2 days we went there was only one lift open apart from the bunny hill and on the first day even this was shut for a few hours in the afternoon.
The toilets weren't very clean and there wasn't much seating outside.
I'm just grateful it wasn't too busy, although why would it have been.
I won't be returning to Selwyn Snow Resort.

review_text:
We visited on Monday. There wasn't much snow, but the beginner slopes were well covered and suitable for skiing. There was also a toboggan area with plastic sleds, which was a lot of fun.

The cafe in the food court makes excellent coffee -- even the decaf was outstanding! Highly recommended. The price was $8.50 for a medium cup, which is a bit steep, but the taste made it worth it.

name: Anita Huang
review_text:
Think twice before taking on the adult first timer lesson.
If there are "experienced" participants in your class, everything would be fast forwarded and then the instructor will conduct the lesson based on their level rather than going through basics in detail(as a real first timer class). the instructor won't be spending time guiding you or providing feedback to help you build up your skills. As a real first timer, I was left behind struggling and mind you there were only four in our class. the instructor would rather "wait" with the other experienced people from a far distance and only came to me to "get me to them" rather helping me understanding what I was doing wrong( this was my second day ever on a snowboard) or pointed out how I could improve myself.
If you start with zero experience, I would recommend you to practice on your own and only join the class when you have some basic skills.  Otherwise you will most likely be left behind and come out of the class with less money in your pocket without gaining anything.
It was a disappointing and traumatized experience.

name: Maheshika Sirisena
review_text:
If your TIME is valuable, this isn't the place for you, don't be fooled by 5 star reviews in here. I  hoped bad reviews on this were just one bad weekend, it isn't. This place wouldn't care about your time, ski hire queue is the slowest queue on earth - we waited for over 3hrs on a not so long queue to get the skis, and it was already midday by the time we got them. name: Tanha Munash
review_text: One of the very best resorts I've been in NsW. Definitely recommend family and friends to visit.

name: Jade Parsons
review_text:
The disorganization and lack of staff for such a small resort is abysmal. We did not attend in school holidays or during a particularly busy period and despite that we waited in line 1hr and 45 mins to collect our pre booked rental equipment.

The facilities are disgusting and noticeably filthy even upon arrival at 8:30am. There were no visible attempts to maintain these throughout the day either.

There is a lack of signage with no clear indication where to go and who can help you. Surprisingly, the snow shop also acts as a service desk, with one attendee who was clearly (and understandably) overwhelmed.

Previous attendees have described the lack of resources during the peak period to which the resort responds saying they had staffed according to anticipated volume during holiday period and in reality it exceeded their expectations. However, we witnessed the same issues outside of this busy period. The problem with this resort is not their inability to cope with volume but simply poor management and organization, period.

All instructors were late for their 9am lessons as supposedly they were held up on the access road which was evidently clear from snow and traffic, it appears their staff is as disorganized as their management.
We were told the instructor would wait while our son waited in line for his rental only to discover they'd proceeded without him.
Ana the Manager was extremely unhelpful nor was she empathetic. Thankfully though, she did eventually manage to move our sons lesson 2 hours after his booked session when finally collected his equipment. We were then met with an instructor who was late and full of attitude and discontent who then proceeded to finish the lesson early because she was hungry and angry (self described).

We witnessed multiple episodes of beginner skiers and boarders falling from the lift without assistance or attention to lift movements whilst the lift attendees threw snowballs at their passing instructor friends,
Or in some instances, the lift was completely unattended.

The food choices are minimal and poor not to mention overpriced. The resort also fail to advertise pricing. The one food attendant lacked customer service skills and general hygiene etiquette and coughed the entire time she sat at the register.

We also witnessed tourists on foot venturing up and down the slopes in the designated ski area without reprimand which is extremely hazardous to themselves and skiers/boarders  alike.

The positives, the young man who eventually served us at the rental counter was very apologetic and kind.
The tobogganing area is great with the functional magic carpet and bolsters at the end. This place has amazing potential to be the perfect spot for families, small resort vibe, the gentle slopes for the kids and affordable group lessons is also very attractive.

Highly recommend getting your rentals elsewhere, take a packed lunch and pre load your passes prior to arrival. We will be back to give it another shot with the above in mind. We hope to see some improvements next year.

name: Travis Macnamara
review_text:
Would have given 1 star, except for the staff who were great even though absolutely under the pump.
Not sure what the management plan is but pretty much felt like 'the wild west'. I know it's fair to have waits during busy periods. Yet we came mid week, beautiful weather. Came to rental que 9;50... got on the snow 1:20pm..crazy business . So many families there for the day.. can't imagine what a bummer it would be for them. Definitely recommend getting all your gear elsewhere. Yet staff were working like ninjas, just need double the amount to do appropriate service in reasonable time.

Racecourse run was closed 'until the weekend' due to staff...Awesome..9 hour drive from Port Macquarie .. next Time we'll just pay the extra and head to Perisher if you want a decent run. I know things depends on weather and snow cover, that's beyond managements control yet staffing which limits full joy of the resort is pretty poor form. Great front run for the newbies or young ones though

name: gimli108
review_text:
Fun little resort, but an honest FYI for anyone wanting to visit.

1) For the love of god, don't hire your gear from here, especially in peak visit periods. Selwyn are significantly understaffed and you will be waiting hours in the line to get fitted. Best to hire where your accommodation is and take your stuff up to the mountain. Some people line up at 8:30am and aren't on the mountain till after 2pm!

2) Bring your own food and drink! Its outrageously expensive and has huge wait times for food and hot beverages. Almost $60 for 2 x (nuggets and chips meal deal).

3) Check the snowcams and make sure there is plenty of snow before you book online (can still book online the morning you are planning to ski). They have a no-refunds policy, even if lifts are shut/on wind hold, you won't get your money back.

If you follow the above advice, it is much cheaper than Perisher/Thredbo and you can have a fun time on the mountain.

review_text: Lucky I didn't need to put on the snow chains, very happy with that. However, I did carry one in the boot. It is illegal not to bring the snow chains with you during that period.

Disgusting service. I paid over 1k for snowboard hire and gear for myself and children and also 2 days of taboggan.

After 30 mins we returned so disappointed to see there is only 1 lift working and you wait 30mins for your turn in order to go back up for the 2 minute snowboard downward. How disgraceful. How horrible!

name: Ashwin Pradeep
review_text: My family went to Selwyn on July 19 to enjoy some snow and toboggan with some friends. We were met with a long line at the front of the building to collect lift and toboggan tickets from one machine as all of the others were not working. The staff also had to keep replacing the cards which added more time onto collecting tickets. They then redirected us to the shop to collect tickets, but it still took time. The toilets were not maintained properly, as it was unclean. The burgers from the bistro weren't good, they only had a small patty, lettuce and tomato all in a soggy bun. There was no mention of the dirty food trays which we could only use. The coffee took a long time as there was only 1 barista making the drinks which lead to long wait times. As well as that, no one was enforcing the tables inside only for people purchasing from the bistro (shown on the signs at the table) because there were many people having BYO food there which made finding a seat really hard despite the reserved seating. Finally, the tobogganing conveyor kept stopping and starting which made us have to either walk on the conveyor or walk up the park. We noticed many people going in the tobogganing park unticketed, as there was no permanent fencing and people were sharing their cards. Overall our visit was not worth the $35 fee per person which could be simply avoided as mentioned before.

name: Julie Morrow
review_text:
I enjoyed my first skiing experience here despite ridiculously poor management of this resort. Before I get into criticisms, shout out to Paige, Sienna and George who were lovely and doing their jobs well.
- the girls bathroom at 2pm on July 16 was the worst public bathroom I ever had the misfortune of experiencing. Of the 10 toilets every single one didn't flush, seemingly the water had been shut off (!!) people had no choice but to go on top of piles left before them. Then there was only a tiny hotel bar of soap left for 10 sinks, as the hand pumps from a few days prior had run out and not been replaced. Even before then, the place always reeked of urine. It seemed the toilets were completely unattended by staff.
- most of the employees were inattentive or rude, including our instructor for first time skiers who choose to humiliate and get mad at us for making mistakes
- the base of the beginner slopes include a steeper slope right in front of exposed metal bars and the chairlift line, making it very intimidating when you are still learning to stop. My first-time skier husband got injured hitting his knee on one of these metal poles
- there are no maps or clear signs of the trails posted anywhere, making it very hard to navigate without someone to guide you
- many chairlifts wouldnt run or would only run for a few hours making the park even smaller than it was
- there was not enough space indoors to sit, even on the the floor, during lunchtime
- long lines for food around lunchtime, and hot food ran out around 12:30, leaving people without viable lunch options

I still managed to enjoy skiing, and got lucky with the lifts being open on our final day, but so much of this resort needs to be improved.

name: Alan Chalmers
review_text: Wish I had read the reviews before we went, there must be a compensation law suit forthcoming. Waited 2 hours for our online pre paid rental ski gear. They didn't even have the right size ski's for my son. Missed my sons lesson because of the wait despite being there early. Wanted to charge us a ridiculous $50 fee to move to a later lesson. Completely disorganised no one managing the place , zero customer service. Ticket machines people couldn't get to work. Inadequate staff for the number of people present there is no organisation to the hire out system. There is no returns area.  I couldn't recommend them any less.

review_text:
Don't recommend going to selwyn especially if you have kids. Only 1 of 3 machines working to get tickets. Hours wait times to get rentals. Big kitchen and hot food bayonets present but no hot food in them. Had some sausages rolls in warmer but dont even have tomato sauce. No hand soap in toilets. Not enough seats, people sitting on ground. Make sure you bring your own food and eat in your car if you still decided to come here. The car park was also full. The whole place is understaffed and needs new management. I find it odd there are no security cameras in this place to.

Save yourself disappointment and go to perisher or Thredbo instead

name: Nigel Stafford
review_text: Chaos. Toilets bad. Lines like airports with 2 hour waits. Missed lessons everywhere. People complaining. Broken ticket machines. No one in control. Good luck people.

name: Hemant Benne
review_text:
A Perfect Family Snow Trip!

We had an amazing time at Selwyn Ski Resort! It's a fantastic spot for families -- our kids had an absolute blast. The staff were incredibly friendly, and the ski lessons were well run. Big shoutout to Paige, who was wonderful with the kids! Paige looks after us last Sunday for a group of 10 kids.

Ski hire was much cheaper than at Thredbo or Perisher, which was a great bonus. While food prices were a bit higher, it's understandable given the seasonal nature of the resort.

The resort closes at 4:30 PM, which actually worked out well for relaxing evenings. The drive up was stunning -- snow-covered and very scenic. We also found more affordable accommodation options nearby in places like Tumut.

Overall, this was our best snow trip yet -- we'll definitely be back super soon!

Pls list a phone number to contact you, would be very handy for people planning it for the first time, few things on the website is confusing, not very clear. Thank you

name: Kim Fermin
review_text:
We visited Selwyn Snow Resort on July 12, 2025, and it was a total disaster. We had pre-booked ski rentals and lift pass expecting a fun and well-organized snow day, but instead spent the entire day stuck in long, disorganized queues. There was absolutely no proper system, no crowd control, and no clear communication from the staff. Despite having a booking, we never received our rentals - just stood in line for hours with nothing to show for it.

The resort was clearly overwhelmed and unprepared for the number of visitors. Staff seemed lost, and no one took responsibility or provided solutions. What should have been a great day out turned into a frustrating, exhausting, and completely wasted experience.

This is unacceptable, and we absolutely deserve a refund for both the poor service and lost time. I strongly do not recommend Selwyn Snow Resort to anyone based on this experience. They need to seriously improve their operations and customer service.

name: Justin Miller
review_text:
I recently visited Selwyn for my first time skiing. While I truly enjoyed the experience of learning to ski, that was in spite of how the resort was managed, not because of it.

Several safety concerns stood out--most notably, the presence of exposed metal fencing around the beginner tracks. Unfortunately, I injured my knee on one of these, which left me feeling that the environment was not as safe as it should be, especially for beginners.

Food options were limited and surprisingly expensive. What made this more frustrating was the lack of visible pricing--there were no price tags, so I only discovered the cost at the register, which felt a bit misleading.
The bathrooms were also disgusting and looked like they had never been cleaned. There was only one soap dispenser and they had replaced the soap with water!

I also found the general attitude of the staff disappointing. During my lesson, the instructor took an unnecessarily harsh tone with participants, singling out individuals for making mistakes and drawing attention to them in a way that felt humiliating rather than constructive. That said, I want to acknowledge that Sienna and Paige were both incredibly kind and helpful, and their friendliness was a real bright spot during the visit.

Overall, Selwyn has potential, but some important changes are needed to make it feel safe, welcoming, and beginner-friendly.

review_text:
Went up on 10th July. Booked in for a skiing lesson.

Resort is nice, didn't wait to get any lunch either. Only me & my husband in the line.
We rented equipment back in Wagga and was the best decision....(do not rent gear from the resort if you don't want to wait).

Few points though;
Only 1 chairlift was open, which made the beginner slopes very busy for beginners and a little scary when experienced people came down the slope really fast. Just a bit too much traffic.

The tables inside were booked up with people's belongings and food boxes, they should be made to hire a locker or eat at their car if they insist on bringing stuff and booking tables. We bought lunch and ended up sitting at someone else's stuff...until they came back.

The ticket machines at entrance, make it a lot easier if they all worked....plus the lady at the front was a bit rude and not very helpful. (Put a smile on ya dile and give Selwyn Snow Resort a happy welcoming face).

Also, say tht all lessons need a helmet to be worn. Common sense i know, but I didn't have one and had to go & hire one before I started my lesson.
It only said children were to wear helmets (unless I missed the bold print about adults too).

Anyway we will be back, but only during the week....due to how busy it gets (which would be every snow resort). Still give you a 4 star because our experience was great and I get places get a bit overwhelming at times...

name: S M
review_text:
I am incredibly disappointed with my experience at your resort over this past weekend (July 12th). My partner and I had arrived at your resort nice and early at 8:15am. We promptly started queuing in the online pick up rental line for our pre-booked Skis Boots and Poles rental. We then had to wait close to FOUR HOURS, arriving at the front of the line close to 12pm. This was shocking enough as is, but what followed was even more shocking.

I told the staff member my skis and boots sizes, and after a long search for my boot size, I was provided with a boot that was larger than the size I requested. I was told that this was ALL THEY HAD left in stock. I tried them on, and they clearly were too big but I was willing to try and make it work just so me and my partner could get out skiing with what was left of the day. However, the complete disorganization continued when I asked for my skis.

I'm 190cm tall, and usually use 170cm skis. The staff member then told me that he couldn't find any in 170cm, so I swallowed my frustration and just asked to get whatever he could get me. He then said all he could offer me was a pair of 150CM SKIS?? The only offers were skis 20 cm too small and boots one size too large, which are unsafe, unprofessional, and negligent, increasing risk of injury! He then disappeared for over 30 minutes trying to find skis somewhere else in the resort, but came back with nothing. I applaud the staff members for their efforts and honestly feel really bad for them and the stress they were under; and all my qualms are with the horrendous management of this whole operation.

But wait, that's not all. After being told that there was absolutely nothing for me...no boots that fit me, no skis above 150cm to use with my boots, we left completely frustrated at 1PM and in disbelief without our pre-booked rentals. We were kindly told by other frustrated customers in the queue that we could head down to Adaminaby to rent some equipment there. So we drove the 50 minutes to adaminaby, picked up skis, boots, poles from the Ampol Ski Hire, which took a total of less than 10 MINUTES for me and my partner, and drove back to Selwyn thinking we could squeeze in at least an hour of skiing before the resort shut. I didn't think it was possible for us to be even more disappointed than we were. But after our return, we were denied entry to Selwyn due to the resort being "overfilled," despite having valid lift passes. We were told to "come back early tomorrow." We had no choice but to drive off to our accommodation and call it a night.

When we spoke with a group of skiers on Sunday who had been a few groups behind us in the queue on Saturday, they advised they had no issues getting fitted with the same ski and boot sizes that we were told were unavailable. It is baffling and deeply frustrating that we were denied these sizes and turned away, yet guests behind us received them without trouble. This points to inconsistent service standards and extremely poor customer service.

The next day (Sunday), we came straight in with our Ampol Ski Hire skis and had a day of skiing. However, the Sunday skiing was overshadowed by the frustration of the previous day's ordeal. Our plan was to spend the whole weekend skiing, and we had driven in from Sydney on Friday night, and left Kozzi back to Sydney on Sunday night to celebrate a birthday weekend. If we had known it was going to only be one day of skiing, we would not have driven a collective FOURTEEN HOURS FOR ONE DAY OF SKIING. 14 hours including the drive to Adaminaby and back, and I haven't even added in the FOUR hours of wasted time waiting in line for NOTHING.

I understand things can get busy during school holidays, but to OVER accept the amount of bookings for entries, as well as rentals in spite of knowing full well how much stock/availability you have, feels like a blatant robbery.

This was an unbelievably negative experience; I have never written a negative review or felt the need to ever do one, but this truly was something else.

The build up of excitement to go skiing for the first time was completely shattered - what an emotionally taxing day. Any nostalgic feeling I have for Selwyn, any feeling of wanting to support after the bush fires is obliterated - I'm so disappointed to have lived through what we did yesterday.

name: D D
review_text:
This may come as a surprise to Selwyn Snowfields, but under the Australian Consumer Law, it is illegal to have a policy of "No refunds under any circumstances". Consumers are entitled to a refund for a service that is not delivered in a reasonable time frame.

Like other reviewers on Saturday 12 July, I prebooked hire skis so that I could get kitted out early and hit the slopes and get a good six hours of skiing in. I would accept 30 minutes waiting for service. I could even accept an hour if management were proactive, and let us know the true situation and appeared to care about their customers, but three hours in and less than halfway to the service desk, and a rather lost site manager who did not seem empowered to do anything but tell people to send an email that would take 10 days for a response. Interestingly, there is pretty quick turnaround on responding to poor Google reviews, maybe the resources are misdirected.

A four hour wait to collect hire skis that can only be used for the remaining 2 hours the lifts are operating would certainly be "not in a timely manner", and cancellation of the hire altogether would most definitely fall into that category, and both obligate Selwyn Snowfields to provide a REFUND. I would encourage anyone that is unable to obtain a refund (not a credit, a refund) to look into  taking the matter to the NSW small claims court, while also claiming compensation for other lost costs such as accommodation,  park entry fees, fuel and wasted time.

And running out of helmets and skis for prepaid bookings reminds me of a Seinfeld episode:
Jerry: "The reservation keeps the car here. That's why you have the reservation."
Rental Car Agent: "I think I know why we have reservations."
Jerry: "I don't think you do. You see, you know how to *take* the reservation, you just don't know how to *hold* the reservation. And that's really the most important part of the reservation: the holding. Anybody can just take them."

name: T K
review_text:
Disappointment was all we had at Selwyn. So many issue there. Particuarly the 4 hour wait for our rentals was a complete joke! Management must be held accountable for this disgusting level of service and professionalism.

Do yourself a favour. Choose another ski resort and you will have a lot better time!

CUSTOMER SERVICE IS NON-EXISTENT. THEY ONLY CARE ABOUT RAISING REVENUE.

We arrived at the resort just after 9am. Instead of skiing, we spent 4 hours standing in a queue to get our pre-purchased rentals. Only 2 staff were serving us with very low speed as if they couldn't see the people waiting. There was no supervisor to assist them. There is clearly a lack of staff training and support from management.

At one stage a woman with a ponytail wearing a black jacket who appeared to be from management came out to address a complaint. I was hoping she could say something to the crowd to at least acknowledge the long wait, but she just left as if she didn't know we were all waiting there for a long time.

A big shout to the young staff member with a curly mullet. He seemed to be the only one who was aware of the people waiting, working at an incredible pace. You could visibly tell he cared and was trying his best to address this situation.

While we were standing there for hours in the queue, we saw those paying on the spot for rentals got their equipment quickly. Of course we could just wait, as they already have our money in their pocket! All they care is their reveue! Not their guests!

I also read some reviews about their no refund policy and that there is no refund even when chairlifts were closed and they kept selling tickets and lessons when there was not enough snow. Selwyn had their excuse in their responses which seemed to be they can't control the weather. All ski resorts face changing weather conditions. Good resorts monitor weather conditions actively and make responsible decisions accordingly. Unfortunately Selwyn does not, because they care about getting more money into their pocket too much!

THE RESORT IS DISORGANISED AND UNPROFESSIONAL

Even though it is a newly built resort, there is a lack of clear signs. When we arrived we saw a queue at the entrance. I had to ask a staff member to confirm this was for scanning the QR code to get our tickets. There was no sign telling us this. There were at least three of these machines. However, only one was working, hence the long queue. There are also no signs to tell you the name of ski trails or chairlifts, or their difficulty levels. I would think having clear signs to at least indicate the difficulty level is an important safety measure at a ski resort!

Chairlift staff were unprofessional. When the gate to the chairlift wouldn't scan properly and open, the staff member looked in our direction for a few seconds she cleared heard the sound from the machine indicating something was wrong, but she just turned her head and ignored us as if she didn't see there was a problem. We were left to solve the problem ourselves.

The getting off area of the beginner lift was so badly laid out that many people fell. There was not enough a slope to ski away quickly from the lift, so you could get caught by the turning chairlift and get knocked over. Although once I knew the issue I could try to ski faster and make a turn to avoid getting caught, it would be very difficult for a beginner skier for whom this trail is designed for. We saw so many people falling there.

Also despite being newly built, there is not even a dedicated area for rental returns. At the end of the day, we were told to  just dump our equipment on the floor. It was a complete mess with half of the entire retal area taken by ski enquipment. There was nowhere even to sit to take my ski boots off.

There was no toilet paper in the women's toilet in middle of the day. I checked at least 3 cells, there was no toilet paper! The toilets were dirty and they didn't seem to have enough cleaners available.

All the above is a huge contrast to our experience at Thredbo. We definitely will NOT visit Selwyn again!

name: Rob Keating
review_text:
After grabbing some Costco vouchers for cheap lift tickets we booked ski gear in advance of a visit to Selwyn on 12/7.

We expected it to be busy, unfortunately the management didn't seem to plan for that.

After getting in the queue to collect the rental gear we thought it would maybe take 30 minutes. Much to our surprise there was no movement at all in the queue in that time.

There seemed to be just two guys working on the pre-booked ski gear section, and they worked at snails pace.

The hours went by and we were still far from being served. Several hours later some other staff showed up, and they actually showed some urgency.

I reached the service counter at 1.11pm after first joining the queue at 9:27am.

Much to my surprise I was taken care of quickly when I was served. I don't know what was going on earlier.

There was a couple that reached the counter, got served but then some equipment wasn't available. The guy serving them actually disappeared for 15 or so minutes and just left the customers standing there with looks of bewilderment on their faces.

Eventually that couple left without the gear that they had expected would be available.

People were talking about leaving the queue and driving to local ski rental places, but those thoughts went out the window when they heard the carpark was at capacity and you would be left without a park if you tried that.

Overall it was the worst experience at a ski resort. Surely the booking system could have shown a bumper crowd was expected.

It seems pre-paid bookings is money in the bank and service delivery was the last of their concerns.

On top of that men's toilets didn't seem to have a cleaner visit at all during the day and they ended up a disgusting mess. I was tolk the women's toilet ran out of toilet paper and was also a mess.

Rubbish didn't seem to be removed for public areas where people were eating.

And now for the snow. When finally getting out there it wasn't so bad, but the short chairlift that ends near the main building had a poorly designed run off area. So many skiers were being knocked over by the chair before they could safely clear that space.

If you are considering a visit to Selwyn, take your own gear.

review_text:
Subject: Disappointing Experience at Selwyn Ski Resort - Request for Resolution

Dear Selwyn Ski Resort Management,

I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction with the experience my family and I had at your resort during our visit on the weekend of July 13, 2025. Arriving at 8.30am Unfortunately, the quality of service we encountered was far below expectations, especially considering the high cost of our visit.

1. Staffing and Operations:
Given the online booking system in place, it would seem that you would have had an accurate indication of the number of visitors for that weekend. However, it was clear upon arrival that your resort was significantly understaffed.

Your rental desk had five counters, yet only two or three were staffed, with minimal assistance provided to the large crowd. We had to wait for over 5.5 hours just to pick up our rental gear.

By the time we were finally on the slopes, it was 2:45 pm, leaving us with just 1 hour of skiing before the resort closed at 4pm. As we had paid for full-day lift tickets for 2 adults and 2 children, this experience was incredibly disappointing.

2. Lift Ticket Machines:
Out of four available machines, only one was functioning, causing lengthy delays and further frustration for all visitors trying to purchase tickets. This level of disorganization is unacceptable for a resort of your size.

3. Food and Beverage Service:
At the cafe, there were only two baristas managing both coffee orders and counter service. The wait times were excessive, with a 45-minute wait for a coffee and hot chocolate, which is simply unacceptable.

4. Facility Cleanliness:
The resort's toilets and other facilities were noticeably unclean, and I did not observe any efforts to maintain or sanitize them throughout the day. This is particularly concerning in a high-traffic environment like a ski resort.

name: Amit Kumar Madaan
review_text:
Selwyn Snow Resort, nestled in the northern Snowy Mountains of New South Wales, offers a welcoming and affordable alpine experience, particularly suited for families, beginners, and those returning to snow sports. 



 Terrain & Facilities

Spanning 45 hectares, Selwyn provides a variety of gentle slopes ideal for novice and intermediate skiers. The resort features 8 lifts, including two chairlifts, two T-bars, a platter, a poma, and two magic carpets, ensuring accessible terrain for all skill levels. Notably, 88% of the terrain caters to beginners and intermediates, with the "Racecourse Run" offering a challenge for advanced skiers.   

After the devastating 2019-2020 bushfires, Selwyn underwent a complete rebuild, reopening in June 2023. The revamped facilities include modern equipment hire, clean dining areas, and efficient lift operations, enhancing the overall guest experience.   



 Family-Friendly Atmosphere

Selwyn is renowned for its family-oriented environment. The resort's layout allows parents to easily supervise children, and the tobogganing and tubing areas are particularly popular among younger visitors. The manageable size of the resort ensures a relaxed and enjoyable experience without the overwhelming crowds found at larger resorts.  



 Affordability & Accessibility

Selwyn stands out as one of Australia's most budget-friendly ski resorts. Adult day passes are priced at AUD 119, with youth and child passes at AUD 95 and AUD 35, respectively.  The resort's proximity to Sydney (approximately a 5-hour drive) and Canberra (about 2.5 hours) makes it an accessible option for day trips or short getaways.  

While there is no on-mountain accommodation, nearby towns such as Adaminaby, Talbingo, and Cooma offer various lodging options to suit different budgets.  



 Snow Reliability & Conditions

Selwyn's lower altitude can lead to variable snow conditions, especially early and late in the season. However, the resort has invested in extensive snowmaking capabilities, covering 35 hectares, to ensure consistent snow coverage. August typically offers the best natural snow conditions, with an average base depth of 26 inches.   



 Visitor Tips
*	Bring Your Own Food: Dining options are limited, and meals can be expensive. Packing your own food is advisable.  
*	Arrive Early: To secure parking and avoid crowds, especially during peak times, it's best to arrive early.()
*	Check Snow Reports: Stay updated on snow conditions and lift operations via the resort's official website before planning your trip.  



 Overall Impression

Selwyn Snow Resort offers a charming and cost-effective alpine experience, particularly appealing to families and beginners. Its recent renovations have enhanced the facilities, providing a comfortable and enjoyable environment. While it may not satisfy advanced skiers seeking challenging terrain, Selwyn's relaxed atmosphere and affordability make it a worthwhile destination for those new to snow sports or looking for a family-friendly getaway.

All in all, a lovely experience (we also got some snow and rain too, which added to the fun). Look forward to being here again next year.
response_from_owner_text: Hi Prachi, Thank you for your kind review! We are glad to hear that you had a great experiance and will pass the positive feedback to the team! We look forward to welcoming you back to Selwyn in 2025!

name: Elijah Mikhail
review_text: Very cheap pricing, fantastic for beginners and people who want to just hit the slopes. They aren't huge runs but they feel great to slide down

name: Shahana Chanda
review_text: It's nice with lots of activities

name: Shakeel Ghauri
review_text: Staff is very helpful. I lost my pass and one of the gentlemen from staff get Mr a new one in no time. Kids enjoys alot with the snow.

name: George Sotirovski
review_text: A perfect winter snow experience

name: Rakesh Bushipaga
review_text: It's a good place to enjoy now, but on my visit, not much snow that day. Better check weather before visiting to enjoy fully

name: james nelson
review_text: Great low-budget family oriented snow resort.

name: L S
review_text:
We had a lovely few days visiting Selwyn this year. Highlights were the prompt and friendly service, tobogganing area and magic carpet are fantastic, it's got a relaxed and friendly vibe - you don't feel rushed and crowded like at other ski resorts. Food prices were high, but it's to be expected with the logistics of getting food up a mountain. We enjoyed the burgers. Plenty of areas to sit and enjoy your own food too.

My son enjoyed his 'first timer' snowboarding lesson. The only minor issue was that it didn't start until 9:15am because the instructors were all talking/socialising and then we waited for someone who was running late. The lesson then finished 10 minutes early at 10:50am, so my son lost 25 minutes of his lesson.

name: daniel bryant
review_text: Love this place! Perfect spot to learn to ski or snowboard with the fantastic international instructors. We had Chrisy from Munich, Germany. She is a legend, so good with the kids. I'm heading back today, I have to retrieve my snowboard.

name: _ Linde
review_text: Make sure you bring snow chains if you're a 2wd they don't have all tyre sizes up there, it's a great place, definitely worth the drive

name: Jason Drury
review_text: Lived it, very good prices for those unable to enjoy the snow at big resort prices.

name: julie mathews
review_text: Was good to watch the kids enjoy them self come down the toboggan

name: Bounce Hippie
review_text: It's really been a long time since I last visited this place. 2006. Looks completely different than the last time I can remember (since I was a kid). Sad to hear it had burnt down druing the bush fires, but glad they were able to build back up and continue running. There is a free lift at the bottom to go to the bigger slops, and a magic carpet for the littler slop. Very glad to have come back and re-vist.

name: Tejay Lovelock
review_text: I specifically went to Mt Selwyn to support them after their years of heartache. It was excellent for my child to learn to ski even on the bad days. I did feel a bit let down that when snow arrived they were not ready to go in opening new terrain or even had their lifts properly serviced to do so (kept breaking down), especially considering how inadequate the immediate slopes are for anyone but first timers. Excellent family resort though without huge ques... but I do hope they can do better in opening up terrain more promptly in the future (when able to do so).

name: Berry Luxury Barn House
review_text: We are a large family with 4 kids and Selwyn was the perfect place for everyone to ski and have a wonderful time. Very easy for the kids to learn, be close and safe. The instructors were absolutely wonderful with our children and were able to pick up skiing straight away. Very good value for money. We can't wait to return!

name: Lozz Croft
review_text: Awful experience.  My voucher didnt work and there is no way to call! You have to email and it takes 5 days to respond.  I had to purchase a other ticket but was told by customer service that i did infact validate all 3! Not true. I validated 3 because i purchased another. Staff at the ski lift were rude and impatient with beginner's. Lady at rentals was so busy servings multiple customers taking 1.15 mins to hire 1 pair of boots!!

name: Hannah Martin
review_text: It took us 90 minutes to collect our passes after pre-booking them online. The machines were broken and there were no signs to indicate where passes should be collected. The men's toilet was completely out of service on a very busy day (weekend and school holidays with good snow conditions) which led to the women's toilets becoming totally filthy.

name: SLC2283
review_text:
Substandard experience. It's hardly operating. Most of the place is closed.

One hour queue for gear, then 90% of the runs were closed despite excellent snowfall. They had more runs groomed but wouldn't operate the associated lifts. We only skied for three hours before the main chair lift broke down, forcing everyone onto the only remaining lift (T-bar) only to have that close too. Without a lift to use, and with most of the place inaccessible, we had to go home early. The resort closes at 4.30 but they had all the lifts shut down at 3.30.

If Selwyn wants customers, it needs to do better. You can't book hundreds of skiers then funnel them into only one ski run and one lift. 90% of the runs are closed. We tried to support their return to operation but it seems all the money has gone into the building and the lifts are broken. It's pretty sad.

Let us know when you're actually back up and running.

name: Josh Smith
review_text: Fantastic place to take your kids to visit the snow

name: Ariful Islam
review_text: Good place

name: Namita Kulkarni
review_text:
Very very very bad stay of 2 days out of which there was no electricity for one whole night with no hot water in bathroom with temperature of -2 no Air-condiction and light and gas heaters were not working either.
Extremely bad room condition with dirty bed spread and quilt.
Bad reception non co operative and rude behaviour.
Please check before you book here

name: Jorham Contreras
review_text: The food and coffee areas have space for improvement. Junk food. Easy tracks, well maintained, good for beginners. Good for families, the tobogganing is fun, great for kids.

name: Marissa Brott
review_text: The last time we went 6 years ago it was amazing at selwyn thick snow  this time a fake snow patch unfortunately I purchased ski lift hire online on a sale but there was not enough snow to want to go back there to use the second day lift pass we were unable to get our money spent on the lift back they offered for us to use the ticket another time  when we do not live there disappointed this time.

name: Melissa Miller-Kelly
review_text:
The taboggan Hill was fab with the magic carpet to take you up! $25 per person per day, not too bad. The food on the other hand $8 for a small cup of chips plus $1 per sauce... Suggest you take a picnic.
A lot of the snow was pretty well compacted so not ideal for snowball fights or building a snowman. *Don't forget $29 per car for parking too.
Staff were very friendly, high5's on the magic carpet and music playing and lady in the front was lovely helping us when the car machine wouldn't print our cards for us.

name: Rebecca Seidman
review_text: Great place, went for the first time instead of going to the bigger snowfields which we normally would do. Staff are extremely friendly and the whole place has a great family feel to it. We only went up for the day just to toboggan as it was our little kids first time at the snow. Great tobogganing area but the magic carpet wasn't working and so we needed to walk up the mountain ourselves which was hard for the small kids, so they were pretty buggered after a few runs. Other than that, it's a cool place and looks like a chilled place to ski/board.

name: Ovisek Lahiri
review_text:
Decent prices and a nice place for beginners and families. Had Tobagonning when we went...
Best to pack and take your own food!

name: Damian Ruggeri
review_text: This place was absolutely a waste of the 3 hour drive it took to get there we got there wen they opened at 8 to start off with the food was terrible wouldn't even feed it to a dog then was on the toboggans from about 8.30 the lift wasn't work had little kids that was made to walk up the hill went and spoke with the lady manager that was just so rude and tried to lie and say the lift was working all morning will never return there again

name: Mati R.
review_text: Nice service

name: Laurie Gambin
review_text: Happy they are back up & trading after the catastrophic fires of a few years ago.

name: Anutka Mas
review_text: Super friendly for kids, great place to start learning everything snow, affordable . No petrol station around, be prepared

name: BoxBoy
review_text: Not much snow this year but everyone had fun anyway.

name: Ouy Tang Jong (Tang)
review_text:
Great resort for families.
Good way to introduce kids to the snow. If you want to keep it simple and cheap you can bring your own food and play with the snow without having to pay for anything. Something that can't be said with other resorts. There are plenty of tables to sit on indoor and out.
You also have an official toboggan and snow tube area. Need to pay $15/$10 per person but the area let's you play all day if you have the energy and toboggans are included in the price.
Snow tubing is $35 per 10 turns but is not limited to one person.
Lifts, ski hire and lessons can be individually purchased or bundled. Prices vary according to the combo you choose.
To get in you need to purchase a national park entrance fee and hire snow chains (even if you don't use them). At the time we went the park entrance was $29 which you pay at the resort as a parking fee. Snow chain hire was $26 which you can pretty much get at any place in Cooma.
Depending how busy it is you need to only park 10 to 200 metres from MAIN building and ski hire right at the entrance.
Food is average pricey fried takeaway food so if you want anything else it is recommended to bring your own. They seem to only accept credit/debit cards
The place seems to be newly renovated and amenities are clean and modern.
On our latest  visit it rain most of the day. 3 lifts were open and only 2 runs open.
(edited and updated 9/07/2024)

name: Sanjeevan Prabahar
review_text:
We had a great time at Selwyn Snow Resort. We only went for the purpose of toboganning as we are not experienced in snow sports. The tobogan area is large and well equipped. It also looked a good place to learn how to ski or snowboard.

The building is well heated and has a cafe.

A good spot for beginners.
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Sanjeevan, 
Thank you so much for the review! We are glad you had a great day and can't wait to welcome you back to Selwyn!

name: Corrado Peluso
review_text: so I bought two tickets on line as a special deal where you need to pre book dates you intend to ski, I booked my first ticket to go last friday and of course I drove all the way down to find no snow and of course no refund which really sucks , surely the same way you book a flight but then if the flight is cancelled due to poor weather (which happens) your flight is just rescheduled....the way this resort is run compared to before the fires leaves a lot to be desired....very disappointed !!

Thank you for the feedback. On this day we had New Chum Chairlift and Wombat T-Bar open. Our snow conditions and snow cams on our website, showing both weather and resort conditions. We hope to see you at Selwyn Snow Resort again soon.

name: Nic Plant
review_text: Dont pre pay for passes. Their non refund policy is no snow, no refund. Pay for passess day before.  Good little small snow resort for families. Not alot of natural snow fall but work hard to make sure that man made snow was available. Tobogganing is fun.

name: Nabila Alkaaf
review_text: Best thing to do for winter activities for beginner and they have tobogganing with elevator so you wont get tired to do it all over again
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Nabila, 
Thank you for the review we are glad to hear you had a great day at Selwyn Snow Resort! We hope to welcome you back soon!

name: Chananrach SATAYAKITKAJORN
review_text:
Great place for the beginners and kids. Trails aren easy. Rentals, lessons and chairlifts's price are resonable. Facilities are all new after rebuilding.
It's good idea to keep an eye on the snow cams before coming because the weather and snow forecast are something that unfortunate and shouldn't complain to the resort. So best to make good plan since everything cost lots.
We've been here twice both before the fire and after and will re-visit again next year.
If possible could we get more table for indoor picnic area in the future?
Keep going Selwyn, we have been watching you though the cams that you are working very hard to create best snow experience for everyone. Cheers!!!

name: Kingsley Lim
review_text: Very nice and modern place, clearly made improvements since the last one got destroyed. Also, skis and ski poles are available at a very low price!

name: ROOFING
review_text: When does the season open?

name: Ashleigh Kaye
review_text: There wasn't a lot of snow fall when we were there in July which is fine, but the machines also weren't on to help so the whole field was sludge. You couldn't ride the toboggans as it was so hard and chewed up you couldn't keep momentum. Paid for the lifts for my son and I and they wouldn't allow me to ride if I didn't gear up, which meant my 9yo wouldn't go on the lifts by himself as he'd never used them before, which was a waste. I contacted customer services and they agreed to refund me my lift pass, which I was grateful for. Months later and back and forth emails they reneged on that and questioned everything I'd relayed in email form after the face to face. So I basically threw away 2 lift passes and 2 tobogganing passes money wise. Will not return. The girl who spoke to customer services for me, was lovely... but overall extremely poor customer service to say the least. (2 stars is generous)
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Ashleigh, 
Thank you for dedicating the time to share your feedback. We regret any inconvenience regarding the snow guns; they can only be activated at specific temperatures, and if conditions aren't favorable, they may not be in operation.

Regarding the lift pass matter, we'd like to highlight that during the purchase process, it's explicitly stated that Selwyn Snow Resort does not permit foot passengers. We appreciate your understanding of these policies.

We're delighted to hear that you had a positive experience with our Guest Services attendant. Your feedback is valuable, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in 2024 for an even better experience.

name: Dan yU
review_text: I reckon Thredbo still better for skiing and snow boarding. Selwyn is smaller and entrance fee is bit expensive than Threbo.

name: Bavananth Thavapalan
review_text: They closed the facility on the day we booked but never informed us. There is no way to communicate with them. We had to waste half a day travelling all the way there and return. Then the refund process is a mess. It has been 3 months and I have only received partial refund.
response_from_owner_text:
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. During the season, if we had to close unexpectedly, we emailed all our guests who had bookings for that day. However, sometimes these emails ended up in junk mail. 

We have processed all refunds and have no outstanding payments. I have also responded to your email which you sent last night to investigate further. 

We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Selwyn in 2024.

name: Gordon McKay
review_text: It's a very scenic area and much less crowded than the other resorts. Unfortunately their snow is less reliable at the lower altitude but it's certainly well visiting when they're open. At my age I now only do X country skiing now but had a fantastic time skiing along the road to Cabramurra after a 20cm snow fall.
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Gordon, 
Thank you for sharing your experience! We appreciate your feedback and are delighted to hear you enjoyed the scenic beauty and cross-country skiing opportunities in the area. We agree that lower altitudes can affect snow reliability, but we're glad you had a fantastic time during your visit. We hope to welcome you again soon!

review_text: sorry but this is a Joke 100 aud for 3 lifts only worth for small children under 6 years to try First time

review_text: Great place to ski or play in the snow. The new facilities look fresh and cater for a large crowd.
response_from_owner_text:

name: Muscle Man (Grand Poobah)
review_text: Such a fun place. I learnt how to snowboard and loved it
response_from_owner_text: Hello! Thank you for your review we are glad you had a great time!

name: Irfan Khan
review_text: Do not buy tobbogan tickets.There is barely any snow this year.Tobogganning ticket sales is just money making.
response_from_owner_text: Unfortunately, we can't control the weather, but we appreciate your feedback and hope for better snow conditions in the future.

name: Adventure Happy
review_text:
Shameless business. They refuse to refund the presale tickets (I.e. want to keep the proceed from presale tickets without providing services) when they fail to make enough snow like the other resorts do

And I agree with the other reviews. The so call toboggan area was very unsafe. There were holes and bumps everywhere. The slope was so icy. If you fell you would get deep scratches

So irresponsible and unethical
response_from_owner_text:
Thank you for taking the time to read this message. We are pleased to offer credits for the 2024 season to those who have Black Friday or Ticket Mania tickets that haven't been redeemed. To see if you qualify, please contact us at info@selwynsnow.com.au.

Unfortunately, Selwyn is located at a lower altitude than other resorts, which means that we experience different weather and temperatures. This can affect our ability to make snow as frequently as we would like.

Regarding the toboggan park, our maintenance team checks the slope every morning to ensure its safety. If it is deemed unsafe, we will relocate it to another spot. However, we cannot control the weather, and throughout the day, the temperature may drop, causing the slope to become icy.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Selwyn in 2024.

name: Diyana Sahariman
review_text:
This ski resort has been upgraded (2023) after big damage from a bushfire (2019).

I love this ski resort because it suitable to bring kids. New facilities are more comfortable and suit us. A lot of parking lots available, new cafe, new toilet, short distance from parking to the ski entrance. I love magic carpet that is useful for toboggan play. So convenient. Pay $25 to play toboggan and u get 1 toboggan to use here.  No outside toboggan allowed

I hope Selwyn Snow Resort could provide more table at outside. I could see there are a lot more space outside. It's good to have more table. It's really convenient
response_from_owner_text:
Hello, 
Thank you for sharing your feedback about Selwyn Snow Resort! We're thrilled to hear that you've had a positive experience at our resort after the recent upgrades. We take pride in providing a family-friendly environment, and we're glad to know that the new facilities, ample parking, and convenient amenities have made your visit comfortable.

name: Brendan

name: Xin Zhang
review_text:
Selwyn Snow Resort is quite good for beginners. We enjoyed the lessons and the skiing. The staff was friendly and helpful. There were only a few trails open in early July. I hope they can open more trails.

My biggest complaint is the communication. The booking website has all sorts of issues. There is only an email enquiry to contact, but it takes weeks to get a response. There used to be a contact number but it's now removed from the website. Dialing the number is just a recorded message without anyone picking it up. I got overcharged with my booking and it still hasn't been resolved after more than a month.

Here are some useful information:

- If you're traveling from/to Canberra, make sure to use B23 the Monaro Highway.

- Similarly, make sure you turn to Link Rd from Snowy Mountains Highway. Google maps may direct you through another trail but that's definitely not for winter.

- The road to the resort is quite good. When we went there it wasn't snowing so snow chain was not necessary. Listen to the local radio for road status.

- There are plenty of parking spaces. It's important to pay for parking, or rather, the national park pass. There are ticket machines on the way to the ski building. You need the license plate number and can buy multiple days of parking at once. We did see ranger checking cars and giving out fines.

- Ski lift ticket can be bought at the front of the building. Or if you booked online, scan the QR code and the ticket will be printed out. You probably don't need to book it prior to arriving but it does make it easier.

- On the other hand, lessons is better to be booking prior to coming as there are limited spots.

- Equipment can be rented once you arrive. It's a slow process as every other reviewer says, so be prepared. The equipment are quite new as the resort only reopened recently.

- There are lockers for rent. $15 for big ones and $10 for small ones daily.

- You can bring your own toboggan and there is a small area where the kids can use it.

Luke is such a cool, knowledgeable, and approachable instructor. He answered all my questions and he even challenged me to do a jump (my first jump) which I successfully executed (didn't fall!).

My kiddo loved the toboggan area. She likes to ride the magic carpet going up to the top for the toboggan. The resort also provide the toboggan so it is not necessary to hire. Note that there is a fee to use it but we think its worth it.

The prices of the food and beverages are reasonable. Its definitely not a like a 'theme park' prices like the others.

I just hope that this resort would get a lot of snow soon. We would definitely come back.

The slope of the resort is very beginner friendly and the vibe of other skiers/snowboarders were all good. Its not so intimidating as the other resorts.

I have been to Selwyn three times and previously I have had a positive experience. However, this final, third visit has demonstrated that good weather is the only thing that makes this resort worth visiting. So don't book in advance because you don't know what the weather will be like. Or you could just go to somewhere better like Thredbo.

This year the slopes were very patchy and yet the snow machines were not being used in the evenings we were there. Only one lift was operational but other slopes looked good enough to ski down so I - along with many others - climbed the mountain, skied down and then climbed again (something we could have done without paying hundreds of dollars for lift tickets). In response to the terrible weather, the resort offered $25 lift tickets, drawing more people to the single over-crowded lift. The resort offers no refunds for not utilising their snow machines or for keeping their lifts closed. This is in stark contrast with other weather-dependant holiday activities I have experienced where the company offers a free or discounted re-booking. The lack of customer care demonstrates to me that this resort cares more about getting paying customers than giving a positive customer experience.

To be clear, the staff at the resort are lovely (hence the 2 stars). My criticism is of the decision makers of this resort. Those who keep the snow machines and lifts off and those who offer cheap tickets to a single over crowded slope.

If they were genuinely apologetic, a credit or refund would be offered to those who booked online in advance but didn't receive what was offered in the descriptions and images. Again, if free or discounted I wouldn't have complained and accepted the declining snow and effort made by Selwyn. But every person paid full price for a below par product. And most we complaining amungst ourselves. I could hear the poor staff copping the verbal abuse. Just wrong on all levels. I hope you are listening Blyton Group or else no one will be back next year. **

On the day you arrive check if the snow cover has deteriorated to either patches of dirt, mud, slush. Check how many Ski lifts are running. Check the Toboggan slope isn't full on dangerous holes. If you have pre-booked tickets online before you arrive, beware.The management team treat you with no respect. Simply stating their terms and conditions show "no refund". Selwyn this is wrong. A manager is there to manage situations. Not to just read policy and walk away. Selwyn is great for beginners when it has snowed, but it is managed extremely bad when there is not enough snow. Selwyn, you should offer a refund or credit when the product you are offering doesn't match what you have sold.

Everyone, hold off booking lift tickets & toboggan tickets until you arrive on the day and see if there is enough snow to actually ski or toboggan. And to see how many lifts are actually running. There is no rush to purchase lift passes or toboggan tickets. These do not sell out. So there is no benefit to pre-booking online before you arrive.

The toboggan slope was unsafe and not usable with large holes all the way down but management disagreed. When it was moved to another area which had snow cover, is was shorter and the slope was too flat to slide all the way to the end. Also, no magic carpet to take you up the hill. I have no complaints if that was free. But management still thought it was fair to charge full price of $25 to use this area. Honestly, it is was no different to taking candy from a baby. Shame on you Selwyn. Won't be back. Next year off to Perisher for free tobogganing on a hill you can slide down without using your hands or becoming injured sliding into large holes.

If you would like Selwyn's management to change, please write a review. No one can control the weather. So i do feel for Selwyn, that it hasn't snowed. But this is not an excuse to take advantage of you and me. They only might consider to do better for next year if they hear from everyone who felt ripped off and taken advantage of.

But I can't help but feel as though management missed an opportunity to really WOW everyone on the long awaited return. We liked:
- ticket machines for the national park pass, although the touch screen was laggy
- attempts to modernise, such as self service ski pass machines
- nice new buildings, and on-site accommodation
- friendly staff

What we didn't like:
- the process to rent ski's was horrendous. Incredibly, horribly slow. There was no sense of urgency, no hustle. We've all driven 5 hours to be there. On one occasion, we waited 30 minutes just to swap a helmet, and we were second in line. It seemed like they didn't have any work benches, so everything had to be done by staff whilst seated on the ground
- expensive food. 8 bucks for a large soy cappuccino. Granted, they now use proper soy milk
- not enough seating. Hundreds of people forced to sit on the ground inside. Those who got a table selfishly left their stuff on it to stop others from using the space. This may be because there weren't enough lockers, but it's more about people lacking courtesy
- slippery tiles in the bathrooms. In the last facility, there were rubber mats laid down
- most of the snow runs were shut down, even though there was plenty of snow. Only the main front runs were operating and they were wearing out
- the T bar lift in the middle kept breaking down, which put huge pressure on the only other run which was to the top. Lines blew out
- getting passes for the second day was a nightmare. It wasn't clear whether our passes from day one were valid for all days, whether we needed to top them up, or whether new passes needed to be printed. There were no staff there to help, 1 out of 3 machines were down, and the line grew and grew. Finally they started working and we got newly printed lift passes.
- at one point I jumped into the line for the shop and gave up after 10 minutes when the line didn't move and there were 10 people still in front of me

Selwyn is a beautiful place and it is great for beginners. If you purchase during the sale period, it's definitely cheaper than all other places around, and its closer to Sydney and Canberra. If they can get their stuff to really hustle I think that would make the most significant difference to the experience

name: Annabelle Wright
review_text:
This review is for everyone who has been trying to find up to date info about the newly opened facilities. Here is the info you need:
The resort is easy to get to, the parking is huge and well organised. There are a lot of disabled spots about 20m from the front door, and the rest of the car parks are between 30m and 100m from the door roughly. Near enough to grab something you left behind.
The facilities are mostly L shaped. The first area you enter has all the ski and clothing hire. The lines weren't great, weren't the worst, but if you can, do yourself a favour and hire your gear in Cooma before you arrive. Cheaper and no queue. Note you don't get toboggans from this hire area.
The further side of the L has good toilets which never had a queue during our visit, and had warm water for washing hands. Nice! Also gender neutral and accessible toilets.
There is food and drink for sale, it's very much a canteen style place, imagine the set and offerings up at most large places like a theme park. Check out my photos for a record of the menu and prices. The food isn't great, it's pre made burgers, chips, pies, hot dogs etc. I think sandwiches are the most healthy option. Pretty expensive but also super convenient for a warm bite to eat. Eg burger was $15, hot dog $10.
There's also a bar/ cafe with a coffee machine and a good range of milks.
I wish they had water refill stations but I didn't see any, I did figure out you need to ask the bar/ cafe staff for a bottle of tap water (glass cafe style) if you need more water. The canteen staff won't give you a top up.
There are lots of benches to eat at both inside and out though many many people left their stuff on the tables unattended all day, you might need to make room to eat.
There is one bank of lockers for hire, $10 or $15 per day depending on the size. See photo.
I can't speak to the ski/ snowboarding or lifts, but the tobogganing was great. It's situated past the main facilities building, over to the left looking outwards. You use your card (which you get when you enter) to scan into the area where you can collect a toboggan. They have a long travelator from the bottom of the hill up to the top so you don't have to climb it! So good. The ride down is fun too, though definately less bumpy in the morning.
There's loads of spaces around the slopes you can explore to build a snowman etc.
Final note, I saw there was mentions online of a taboggan fast run, and possibly also an ice skating rink etc. These things aren't there, or certainly weren't there in early July 2023.
Overall, amazing time, very fun, great for kids!
Fingers crossed they will update their website with all this info soon!

All the staff we friendly and it was obvious that this is a family run snow field. We did have a small issue, however the ski team handled this very well.
We did have an issue with another skier and again the staff (ski patrol) were there to sort it out so everyone could get on with a great experience.
If you are keen to learn to ski, this is the place to go. Most people have low ski skills so perfect. Wide runs and no queues! And I mean no (or extremely short) queues - even during the school holidays whilst we were there.
Don't travel all the way there for the food, however you park your car so close that you can drop by the car to collect your own food. On the other hand, make sure you also support them. Overall is 1/3 the price of the big resorts.
Stop delaying, like I did for years. Go. Your kids will love it.

review_text:
Avoid this place. No good.
We went there last year (2018).
We was attracted by their website claiming it is a family friendly ski resort. After going to Perisher for 3 years we decided to try somewhere different. So we went to Selwyn Snow Resort for 4 days.
One afternoon, when using the chair life, my son (7 years old and can ski freely on green trails) sat too fast when the chair came, he fall down under the chair, was dragged at least 5 meters! Luckily I was with him at the time however I was on the chair already and couldn't jump off to rescue. The life operator didn't stop the lift immediately, instead he ran up and tried to drag my son out from under the chair! I cried out and ask him to stop the lift immediate. My son was so scared and didn't stop crying. The back of his ski jacket had a long cut by the sharp metal under the chair and his back was injured too, with broken skin and a few drops of blood. If the guy stopped the lift immediately (he stood less than a meter from the control button) all the injury can be avoid. How much loss they will suffer from stopping the lift once?!
Because of the pain and scare, my son couldn't walk fast. The operator became very impatient and kept yelling us to move out quickly and don't block other people's way. Didn't even ask or offer a checkup. A rescue snow motorbike passed and stopped to ask if everything was ok, however the rider refused to take my son up to the Centre despite he did drive up to that direction. My son was too scary to take the chair lift again, so we had to walk up the hill by ourselves holding ski boards on hands! On deep snow! My son's shoes were all wet when we walked up the hill.
The the second day, we went to the information desk and made a formal complaint. The lady was nice but didn't show much interest in investigating. Wrote down our contact detail but we heard nothing from them ever since.
We won't even go back again, and I am spreading the words among my friends and business network to avoid this place, just don't want other people to suffer if same thing happens to them.

Zero service management. Although, It is good for beginners who wants to do skiing, they must provide some good customer service for visitors.
In their website there is no option to opt only for ski training without lift pass. They charge $100 for a lift pass, but the same can be bought for $50 with GroupON coupon. So we wanted to buy only ski training from there website. We called them dozen times to enquire about training pass, snow fall etc. But no one picks up the call.
If you have an option to rent ski costumes, somewhere where you are staying, then it is always better to get them there, instead of standing in long queues in selwyn. Yes, very very long queues ( nearly an hour) even if you want to rent a single helmet as well. If they are ready to accomodate hundreds of people in their resort, they should also think of having multiple customer service points, multiple costumes rental services. It is totally waste of time to wait in so much long queues first for paying, and then for checking your size costumes, exchange rooms, etc. Trust me, you will feel frustrated by their services, if you go on weekends peak seasons.
Second thing is no mobile network, no internet, no wifi. They should have atleast provided wifi just like in Perisher. It is really difficult to communicate with family members without mobile in a strange place.
Third thing, the most horrible toilets. Kids were crying and refusing to go inside the toilets, because of very bad and pathetic smell. Worst part is, there is only one toilet place in the entire Selwyn. They charge us so much for entry fees ($40 per day), trainings, lift, tubbogan etc. Why can't they maintain clean toilets.
Fourth and last thing is, there is no good restaurant or food court which provides food for whole day. There is only one food canteen, which close there meals section once all the burgers( they already preapred for a day) are over. We went to have meals at 12.30 on Sunday, but there was nothing available except french fries. Its always good to carry your own food.
